full_text: Terribly saddened to hear of the passing of Brian Whiston, the state superintendent of Michigan. He was a strong voice for improving student outcomes. He will be missed.
Congratulations to the class of 2018! I wish you all the best as you embark on the next step of your journey.

As you venture out into the world, know that your life won’t always unfold according to plan. Anticipate being called to something different, to something unexpected. Don’t avoid a change in course, an alternate path. Don’t fear the unknown. Embrace the mess.

What will you do to put your newly gained skills to work in service of others? Now is the time to start doing it. And what you do now is up to you. It’s not up to your parent’s. It’s not up to your teachers. It’s up to you. As Mother Teresa said, "Find your own Calcutta." https://t.co/RwrJVwUOpr

America is the most prosperous nation on the face of the earth, and it’s also the most generous. But that strong tradition isn’t just passed along from generation to generation in the blood stream.

It’s taught.
It’s learned.
It’s shared.
No matter your anticipated profession, each of you has the potential to make a profound difference for others. https://t.co/YFxMphljj3

I want to focus on a key component of life that’s at the core of what it means to be an American: service. Public service isn't self-service. It's about serving others. For me, it’s the moral obligation to expand educational opportunities for *each* and *every* child.

As I addressed the 2018 graduating class of @avemariauniv this morning, I reflected on graduates from all across the country. God gave each of us unique talents and we can choose what to do with them. However, we should not bury them in the ground. I urge you to go for greatness.

Wonderful to have 8th graders from The Potter's House join us at ED during their trip to DC to discuss their dreams for the future and their incredible interest in public service. You make Michigan proud! https://t.co/84LqYkhKLY
Thanks for today’s conversation, @EllenStofan. It was a pleasure to discuss STEM and the exciting educational opportunities that the National @airandspace Museum has to offer. https://t.co/OH93tJmkzK

Pleased to visit with all our nation's State Teachers of the Year. You are the ones on the front lines with the most important constituents we have – students. Thank you for your commitment to helping students learn and grow. https://t.co/35YK0TdW7t

full_text: My heart is broken for the family and friends of Jaelynn Willey, one of the victims of the recent shooting at Great Mills High School in Maryland. This tragedy further underscores our need to act with urgency to ensure our students and teachers are safe at school.

Important step today as @POTUS signs #STOPSchoolViolenceAct into law. This law will help make students and schools safer – providing states and communities with assistance in their efforts to prevent school violence.
Education can truly change the trajectory of a child’s life – all they need is the chance to attain it. That is the focus of this administration and the focus of this budget.

The federal government does not and cannot know the unique needs of each individual student in America. Parents and teachers know their students and their needs best. With this budget we can continue to return power to those who walk side-by-side with students every day.

The Budget eliminates, streamlines or reduces funding for many discretionary programs that do not address national needs, duplicate other programs, are ineffective, or are more appropriately supported with State, local, or private funds – reducing taxpayer costs by $6.7 billion. https://t.co/aQKnsSDBBL

This budget sharpens and hones the focus of our mission: serving students by meeting their needs. This Administration is committed to reducing the federal footprint in education and improving opportunities and outcomes for all students while returning power to those closest them.
Pleased to testify before @HouseAppropsGOP to testify on the President’s FY2019 Budget Request for the Department. Our budget puts students first.
Horrifying situation this morning at @GMHS_SMCPS. Our hearts and prayers are with those impacted, and our deep appreciation goes out to the first responders. @usedgov stands ready to assist.

Agree — nothing is more important than protecting America’s students. Appreciate your leadership on the issue and all the ideas we’ve received as we work to ensure that every student and teacher feels safe in our nation’s schools. https://t.co/NzIMyZMyeU

full_text: I don’t trust Washington or those who blindly defend the status quo. I trust parents and teachers, and I believe in students. We must do better for them. We must do better for our teachers, for our parents, for our students, for our country. #PTALegCon
It’s time we pursue a paradigm shift, a fundamental reorientation – a rethink. https://t.co/tWfEmJnGYO

We must always encourage a culture of creativity and innovation in education – always challenge ourselves to do better in the same way we always challenge our students to do better. Our children deserve learning environments that are agile, relevant, exciting. #PTALegCon

The federal-first, top-down approach distorts what education ought to be: a trusting relationship between teacher, parent and student. Ideally, parent and teacher work together to help prepare a child for a fulfilling life and successful careers. #PTALegCon
Greater empowerment can’t be limited to just parents. We need to give teachers more flexibility too so they can implement their own creative solutions to better meet students’ needs. #PTALegCon
Parents have the greatest stake in the outcome of their child’s education. Accordingly, they should also have the greatest power to make sure their child is getting the best education. #PTALegCon

I will lead a Federal Commission on School Safety which will focus on identifying solutions and best practices from educators, parents, mental health professionals and law enforcement to assist states and communities in their efforts to prevent school violence.
Yesterday, we announced concrete steps this Administration is taking to ensure the safety of our children and prevent school violence. https://t.co/jsKfC1WJF3 https://t.co/GQGxPXFw2J

The tragedy in Parkland, Florida was a sad reminder that there is still much work to be done to ensure no parent, no teacher, no student has to again endure what many did at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School.

Yet another thing you didn't see on @60Minutes: I did respond to this misguided question. Every student should have the opportunity to learn in the way and at the pace that best fits their unique needs, regardless of zip code or family income. https://t.co/LbXjOcSkH2
I’m fighting every day for every student, in every school – public and private – to have a world-class education. We owe that to our children. https://t.co/KoMDYQk8xs

quoted_status.full_text: “They obviously haven’t talked to the many parents who want to have the chance to choose the right education for their child” -@BetsyDeVosED on HuffPost saying school choice is a ‘lie’ https://t.co/E0uhxuiOeC

full_text: Also missing from @60Minutes: students at charter schools in Detroit are doing 2x better than their peers. The reforms are helping, but there’s so much more to do. We must help all students be better prepared for strong futures. https://t.co/nZ8iqHhLBd https://t.co/xoiegl2VF1

Here’s what we shared with @60Minutes, which of course they didn’t show you: Michigan, like much of the nation, isn’t doing well enough to prepare students. Scores are stagnant. Students need more options, and we must rethink our approach to education. https://t.co/GJ0kdI2GPE

Great public schools will always work well for many kids, but if it’s not working for an individual child, they should have access to options. No one should ever feel trapped or stuck. No parent should have to feel like they are settling when it comes to their child’s education.

What I hate is for kids to lose the opportunity to reach their fullest potential. I hate when private schools fail kids, when charter schools are bad actors, and any time that adults let student down. #60Minutes

I love great public schools, and l love great teachers. Public schools will always be a critical part of the mix in American education. I don’t care where you go to school, as long as where you go to school works for you. #60Minutes https://t.co/pLTCgM7kEU

All students must be safe and protected in their learning environment. While there is no one-size-fits-all approach for every state, or for every school, we will continue to raise the questions, ideas and solutions that keep students safe as they pursue their passions at school.

I am humbled to chair the Federal Commission on School Safety which will help bring forward solutions and identify best practices from state and local communities that will truly work to keep students safe.

Very appreciative of @SenAlexander's leadership and commitment to improving school safety. I look forward to working with him and leaders from both parties to address this important issue & highlight solutions from states, districts & schools that'll help our teachers & students.

Today’s visit was very sobering but also inspiring. We are committed to continuing our work to find solutions so that no student or parent has to go through what this community has had to endure. We are committed not only to listening, but acting. https://t.co/hCLfolZhOY

full_text: Be different. Be bold. Try something unexpected. Do something new. #RethinkSchool

What students really need won’t originate in Washington. It will come from entrepreneurs, philanthropists, teachers and parents – those closest to students. And it may well come from the students themselves. #SXSWEDU

“Rethink” means we question everything to ensure nothing limits a student from pursuing his or her passion, and achieving his or her potential. So that each student is prepared at every turn for what comes next. #SXSWEDU

After learning that @FAFSA – a lender with one of the largest consumer loan portfolios – doesn’t have a mobile app, I challenged our team to bring federal financial services into today’s reality. Looking ahead to the next generation, we're developing an app that will soon launch.

The most recent Program for International Student Assessment report has the U.S. ranked 23rd in reading, 25th in science and 40th in math. That’s middle of the pack. Average. A flat line. #SXSWEDU https://t.co/MdEFhGFqh4

Does this look familiar? Students lined up in rows. A teacher in front of a blackboard. Sit down; don’t talk; eyes up front. Wait for the bell. Walk to the next class. Everything about our lives has moved beyond the industrial era. But American education largely hasn’t. #SXSWEDU https://t.co/kyy2r7bTud
Sad to see dedicated public servant @SenThadCochran leave the US Senate. I wish him all the best as he embarks on the next chapter of his life – he will be missed.

We must pursue a paradigm shift – a fundamental reorientation – a rethink. Question everything, at every school, in support of every student’s success.
We can act now. We must act now.
ESSA plans aren’t a ceiling. There is no ceiling. There is no ceiling on what students can achieve. These plans merely establish the floor!
The imperative to do something shouldn’t have to come from Washington. It shouldn’t have to come from your state capital. The imperative to do better comes from students. #StatesLeading

Multiple governors shared concerns about their state's plans. One warned that "adding layers of bureaucratic paperwork does little to help low-performing schools." Another lamented his state's plan "includes provisions aimed at preserving the status quo in failing schools."

Just because a plan complies with the law doesn’t mean it does what’s best for students. Sure, they may pass muster around conference tables in Washington, but the bare minimum won’t pass muster around kitchen tables. #StatesLeading

The Every Student Succeeds Act provided increased state and local flexibility to ensure the educational success of our students. But there are far too many plans only meeting the bare minimum required by law. We can and must do better for our students. @CCSSO

If 4th causes the @USOlympic to take a hard look at improving, shouldn't ranking globally 24th in reading, 25th in science and 40th in math spark some change? The time is now to empower parents and teachers to help students learn and grow. https://t.co/hQeiWjGHT7

.@POTUS is proposing the most ambitious expansion of education choice in our nation’s history. #EdRevolution
I firmly believe every state should provide choices and embrace equal opportunity in education. But those are decisions states must make.
We won’t accomplish our goals by creating a new federal bureaucracy or by bribing states with their own taxpayers’ money. #EdRevolution
In order to succeed, education must commit to excellence and innovation to better meet the needs of individual students. #EdRevolution
If we really want to help students, everything about education must focus on individual students – funding, supporting & investing in them.
Everyone – in both parties – should support equal opportunity in education, regardless of a child’s income, zip code or family circumstances
If you hear nothing else I say tonight, please hear this – education should not be a partisan issue. #EdRevolution

full_text: The greatest opportunity for each child to reach his or her full potential & pursue the American Dream is through a great education.
Children have the opportunity to flourish as their teachers & administrators innovate & tailor education to the needs of their students.
Thank you @EricGordon_CEO @CLEMetroSchools for helping encourage this program.
… and it introduces them to skills and subject-areas with high-potential futures. (2/2) .@CLEMetroSchools
.@CLEMetroSchools hands-on experience encourages students to engage in ways the traditional classroom often does not… (1/2)
.@CLEMetroSchools “Project Lead the Way” connects students with engineering businesses and organizations in the community.
.@DPSNewsNow “Success Express” is a great example of how LEAs are leveraging federal, state and local funds to best serve children.
.@DPSNewsNow provides transportation to children from under-served areas to schools in other regions of the city.
It’s this kind of local control that we want to empower.
Now parents are in direct control. The community takes ownership of developing the School 15’s structure, staffing and performance.
... but in recent months, parents & teachers in Indy have come together to propose School 15 become a “neighborhood-run” school. (2/2)
.@ipsschools School 15 has struggled for years with low-test scores, and the state gave it an “F” in 2016... (1/2)
.@ipsschools Innovation Schools are freed up to operate independently & thus better attune themselves to the unique needs of their students.
Let me highlight and celebrate creative, out-of-the-box approaches.
When Washington gets out of your way, you should be able to unleash the potential of creative thinking to set children up for success.
No parent should feel like @USEDGOV thinks it knows better than they what is best for their child.
No teacher in any classroom should feel like @USEDGOV is holding them back from success with their kids.
This isn't right, nor is it acceptable. Under this Administration, we will break this habit.
Too often, @USEDGOV has gone outside established authority & created roadblocks – wittingly or unwittingly – for parents & educators alike.
No two schools are identical, just like no two students are alike. We shouldn’t assume that the same answer will work every time.
... that prepares them to graduate high school ready for college or career education. (2/2)
#ESSA requires states to ensure ALL students have access to excellent teachers & a positive, safe learning environment... (1/2)
#ESSA provides states the latitude to do what’s best for children while preserving important civil rights protections.
#ESSA ensures transparency and accountability provisions for all schools.
We’re doing what’s best for children by implementing #ESSA as Congress intended, w/ the freedom & flexibility state & local leaders deserve.
The underlying principles of #ESSA are built on that same trust.
My philosophy is simple: I trust parents, I trust teachers and I trust local school leaders to do what’s right for the children they serve.
I support great public schools & I support great public school teachers, because I support students – ALL students.
If a child is able to grow and flourish, it shouldn’t matter where they learn.
In too many cities and states, parents are still denied the simple but critical choice of what school their child attends.
When parents are empowered to take charge of their children's education, when they have quality options, we see better results for students.
Parents know better than any politician or administrator the unique needs of each of their children.
I’ve seen the changes in a community when it chooses to come together and invest in the rising generation.
My heart has leapt to see big smiles on the faces of kids who are in a school that welcomes, challenges & embraces them for who they are.
I got involved in education because I saw firsthand how many children & parents struggled to find a school that met their needs.
Follow along as we live tweet the Secretary’s remarks to @GreatCitySchls, starting right now. - ED staff
Excited to speak with @GreatCitySchls today about giving state & local leaders freedom & flexibility under #ESSA to better serve students.

We need more good schools. We need more good teachers. And no child should be denied the opportunity to enter a great school. Not one.
#HBCUs remain at the forefront of opening doors that had previously been closed to so many.
But your history was born not out of mere choice, but out of necessity, in the face of racism, and in the aftermath of the Civil War.
Providing an alternative option to students denied the right to attend a quality school is the legacy of #HBCUs.
#HBCUs are such an important piece of the fabric of American history—one that encompasses some of our nation's greatest citizens.

quoted_status.full_text: Met with Education Secretary DeVos to outline AASA's education policy agenda and budget priorities. A good start to our discussions. https://t.co/a8iL1AO0qX

full_text: Great discussion with the #TeachersAtED fellows. Looking forward to many more. Thanks for all you do! https://t.co/IEgmTg4xvH
I consider protecting all students, including #LGBTQ students, not only a key priority for the Department, but for every school in America.
Schools, communities, and families can find – and in many cases have found – solutions that protect all students.
A federal court in August 2016 issued a nationwide injunction barring the Department from enforcing a portion of the previous guidance.
This is not merely a federal mandate, but a moral obligation no individual, school, district or state can abdicate.
We have a responsibility to protect every student & ensure that they have the freedom to learn and thrive in a safe and trusted environment.
Read my full statement on #TitleIX here: https://t.co/amUYjBFfIn
.@JATrojans Great teachers deserve freedom and flexibility, not to constantly be on the receiving end of government dictates.
.@JATrojans Your teachers are awesome! They deserve MORE freedom to innovate and help students.
I am committed to #IDEA and ensuring a quality education for children with disabilities. (5/5)
We are now working with stakeholders on updating these #IDEA resources to be even more useful and user friendly. (4/5)
After learning of the site’s crash, I directed @ED_SpEd_Rehab to ensure the site was restored and maintained. (3/5)
The https://t.co/NXCUojxx0D site and its server were neglected for nearly four years. This behavior is unacceptable. (2/5)
https://t.co/NXCUojxx0D has been repaired and moved to a new server to ensure it’s available to parents & educators who rely on it. (1/5)
